alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 6:46AM EDT until August 11 at 9:13AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River at Andover. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Floodwaters encroach on very lowest lying business parking lots off of Route 114 in Lawrence and North Andover that are adjacent to the Shawsheen River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 29.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 0.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EDT Friday was 30.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 25.7 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.2 feet on 09/04/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 915 AM EDT.
